SupportingEvidence: Dominant mature hepatocyte metabolic program (CPS1 urea cycle, HMGCS2 ketogenesis, CYP2E1/AOX1/ADH1A/ADH4 xenobiotic metabolism)
Enrichment of liver-secreted plasma proteins (APOA1/APOE/APOC3, FGA/FGB/FGG, KNG1, ITIH1, AMBP, VTN, AFM)
Markers align with differentiated hepatocyte identity typical of fetal-type hepatoblastoma
Lack of progenitor/cholangioblastic markers (e.g., EPCAM, KRT19, AFP, DLK1) among top genes argues against embryonal/mixed components
No evidence of high-proliferation/angiogenic signatures expected for macrotrabecular patterns
SuggestedExperiments: IHC/IF for CPS1, HMGCS2, CYP2E1, APOA1, HNF4A to confirm hepatocyte differentiation
IHC for EPCAM, KRT19, AFP, GPC3, DLK1 to exclude embryonal/mixed components
Ki-67 staining to validate low proliferative fraction
Functional assays: urea production, CYP2E1 activity, and ketone body output (HMGCS2) in sorted cluster-0 cells
Histopathology review (H&E) for fetal morphology and absence of macrotrabecular architecture
Spatial transcriptomics or RNA in situ for CPS1/HMGCS2 to localize fetal-like regions
